Package edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.attributes

Class BaseActorAttribute

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.attributes.BaseActorAttribute
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActorAttribute<java.lang.Integer>
public class BaseActorAttribute
extends java.lang.Object
implements ActorAttribute<java.lang.Integer>
A class that represents a basic attribute of an actor, such as health.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    BaseActorAttribute​(int maximumPoints)
    At the start of the game, the points of the attributes match the maximum points.

  • Method Summary

    void decrease​(java.lang.Integer points)

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseActorAttribute

      public BaseActorAttribute​(int maximumPoints)
      At the start of the game, the points of the attributes match the maximum points.
      Parameters:
      maximumPoints - the maximum points of the attribute

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update​(java.lang.Integer points)
      Overwrites the current points of the attribute with the given points. Sets the current points to either the given points or the maximum points, whichever is lesser.
      Specified by:
      update in interface ActorAttribute<java.lang.Integer>
      Parameters:
      points - the points to overwrite the current points of the attribute

    • increase

      public void increase​(java.lang.Integer points)
      Increases the current points of the attribute by the given points. It ensures that the new points do not exceed the maximum points by taking either the new points or the maximum points, whichever is lesser.
      Specified by:
      increase in interface ActorAttribute<java.lang.Integer>
      Parameters:
      points - the points to increase the current points of the attribute

    • decrease

      public void decrease​(java.lang.Integer points)
      Decreases the current points of the attribute by the given points. It ensures that the new points do not fall below 0 by taking either the new points or 0, whichever is greater. For example, the stamina (another example of a basic attribute) of the actor cannot be a negative value
      Specified by:
      decrease in interface ActorAttribute<java.lang.Integer>
      Parameters:
      points - the points to decrease the current points of the attribute

    • get

      public java.lang.Integer get()
      Getter for the current points of the attribute.
      Specified by:
      get in interface ActorAttribute<java.lang.Integer>
      Returns:
      the current points of the attribute

    • getMaximum

      public java.lang.Integer getMaximum()
      Getter for the maximum points of the attribute.
      Specified by:
      getMaximum in interface ActorAttribute<java.lang.Integer>
      Returns:
      the maximum points of the attribute

    • updateMaximum

      public void updateMaximum​(java.lang.Integer points)
      Overwrites the current maximum points of the attribute with the given points.
      Specified by:
      updateMaximum in interface ActorAttribute<java.lang.Integer>
      Parameters:
      points - the points to overwrite the current maximum points of the attribute

    • increaseMaximum

      public void increaseMaximum​(java.lang.Integer points)
      Increases the current maximum points of the attribute by the given points. This will add to the existing maximum points of an attribute without overwriting the maximum points.
      Specified by:
      increaseMaximum in interface ActorAttribute<java.lang.Integer>
      Parameters:
      points - the points to increase the current maximum points of the attribute

    • decreaseMaximum

      public void decreaseMaximum​(java.lang.Integer points)
      Decreases the current maximum points of the attribute by the given points. This will subtract from the existing maximum points of an attribute without overwriting the maximum points.
      Specified by:
      decreaseMaximum in interface ActorAttribute<java.lang.Integer>
      Parameters:
      points - the points to decrease the current maximum points of the attribute
